---
title: qPCR variance
subtitle: How much variance is introduced by varying qPCR protocols across different dimensions?
author: Simon Grimm
date: '2024-04-04'
toc: true
format:
  html:
    code-fold: true
    code-tools: true
    code-link: true
    df-print: paged
execute:
  freeze: auto
cap-location: bottom
---

# Introduction

This is research based on the "[Pooled swab sampling for pathogen early detection](https://naobservatory.org/blog/investigating-the-sensitivity-of-pooled-swab-sampling-for-pathogen-early-detection)" project.

In our swab sampling research we want to compare qPCR results across different studies. Doing this requires a better understand how much variance is introduced by differing qPCR protocols. In the study [Assessing the comparability of cycle threshold values derived from five external quality assessment rounds for omicron nucleic acid testing](https://virologyj.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s12985-023-02032-z) researchers compared the qPCR results across many different laboratories who all used different combinations of qPCR machines, qPCR kits, and nucleic extraction methods. We can use this data to get an initial idea of how differing qPCR results might differ from one another.


# Differing qPCR kits


## Plotting qPCR results for different qPCR kits

::: {#f887dfa6 .cell execution_count=2}
``` {.python .cell-code}
data = pd.read_csv("data/s1-qpcr-kits-claude.tsv", sep="\t")
data = data.apply(lambda x: x.str.strip() if x.dtype == "string" else x)
data.columns = [col.strip() for col in data.columns]

Y_MIN, Y_MAX = (28,40)


unique_combinations = data[['qPCR target', 'extraction kit', 'PCR instrument']].drop_duplicates().values.tolist()
concentrations_per_ml = ["2_e3", "1_e3", "5_e2", "2_e2"]

table_iterator = -1
for qpcr_target, extraction_kit, pcr_instrument in unique_combinations:
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(9, 5))
    table_iterator += 1

    sub_table = data[(data['qPCR target'] == qpcr_target) & (data['extraction kit'] == extraction_kit) & (data['PCR instrument'] == pcr_instrument)]
    qpcr_kits = sub_table['RT-PCR kit'].unique().tolist()
    n_qpcr_kits = len(qpcr_kits)
    x_increment = 0.7 / n_qpcr_kits
    x_offset = -0.45
    for qpcr_kit in qpcr_kits:
        x_offset += x_increment
        y_means = sub_table[sub_table['RT-PCR kit'] == qpcr_kit][["mean_2_e3", "mean_1_e3", "mean_5_e2", "mean_2_e2"]].values.flatten()
        n_labs_values = sub_table[sub_table['RT-PCR kit'] == qpcr_kit][["n_labs_2_e3", "n_labs_1_e3", "n_labs_5_e2", "n_labs_2_e2"]].values.flatten()
        min_n_labs = min(n_labs_values)
        max_n_labs = max(n_labs_values)
        if min_n_labs == max_n_labs:
            n_labs_label = f"n = {min_n_labs}"
        else:
            n_labs_label = f"n = {min_n_labs} - {max_n_labs}"

        y_sds = sub_table[sub_table['RT-PCR kit'] == qpcr_kit][["sd_2_e3", "sd_1_e3", "sd_5_e2", "sd_2_e2"]].values.flatten()
        x_values = [x + x_offset for x in range(len(y_means))]
        ax.errorbar(x_values, y_means, y_sds, alpha=0.5, label=f"{qpcr_kit}\n({n_labs_label})", fmt='o', linestyle='None')
        ax.legend(loc='upper center', bbox_to_anchor=(0.5, -0.05), frameon=False, ncol=4, title="qPCR kit")

    ax.set_ylim(Y_MIN, Y_MAX)
    ax.set_xticks(range(len(y_means)))
    for x in range(Y_MIN, Y_MAX, 2):
        ax.axhline(x, color='gray', alpha=0.1)
    x_labels = []
    for concentration in concentrations_per_ml:
        tidy_concentration  = concentration.replace("_", " ").replace("e", "E")
        label = f"{tidy_concentration} gc / ml"
        x_labels.append(label)
    ax.set_xticklabels(x_labels)
    qpcr_target, extraction_kit, pcr_instrument = qpcr_target.strip(), extraction_kit.strip(), pcr_instrument.strip()
    plt.title(f"qPCR target: {qpcr_target}, Extraction kit: {extraction_kit}, PCR instrument: {pcr_instrument}")
    # drop top and right spine
    ax.spines['top'].set_color('none')
    ax.spines['right'].set_color('none')

```

## Plotting aggregate distribution of samples where only the qPCR kit differed

It is hard to discern how much variance there is between all the different kits, even within one concentration level. Something we can do to help make the variance more visible is to i) look only at examples where the qPCR kit differed, ii) take the means and standard deviations of the samples from each qPCR kit at a given concentration level, and iii) sample each qPCR kit's distribution, weighed by the number of labs using that kit.[^1]

[^1]: This might well be wrong: A standard deviation already contains information on the number of underlying samples.

::: {#4776fc6e .cell execution_count=3}
``` {.python .cell-code}
data = pd.read_csv("data/s1-qpcr-kits-claude.tsv", sep="\t")

data.columns = [col.strip() for col in data.columns]

absolute_sample_size = 3000
XMIN, XMAX = (-10, 10)

# only keep rows where neither extraction kit orPqCR instrumet are == "various"
data = data[~data['extraction kit'].str.contains("various")]
data = data[~data['PCR instrument'].str.contains("various")].reset_index()

unique_combinations = data[['qPCR target', 'extraction kit', 'PCR instrument']].drop_duplicates().values.tolist()

n_unique_combinations = len(unique_combinations)

fig, axs = plt.subplots(n_unique_combinations, figsize=(9, 5), sharex=True)

concentrations_per_ml = ["2_e3", "1_e3", "5_e2", "2_e2"]

for i, (qpcr_target, extraction_kit, pcr_instrument) in enumerate(unique_combinations):
    sub_table = data[(data['qPCR target'] == qpcr_target) & (data['extraction kit'] == extraction_kit) & (data['PCR instrument'] == pcr_instrument)]

    distributions = []
    y_axis_labels = []


    for concentration in concentrations_per_ml:
        means = sub_table[f"mean_{concentration}"].values.tolist()
        sds = sub_table[f"sd_{concentration}"].values.tolist()
        n_labs = sub_table[f"n_labs_{concentration}"].values.tolist()
        total_labs = sum(n_labs)
        sample_per_lab = absolute_sample_size // total_labs

        samples = np.hstack([np.random.normal(m, sd, sample_per_lab * n) for m, sd, n in zip(means, sds, n_labs)])
        mean = np.mean(samples)
        distribution_around_zero = samples - mean
        distributions.append(distribution_around_zero)
        y_axis_labels.append(concentration + "\n" + f"n = {total_labs}")



    sns.violinplot(data=distributions, ax=axs[i], orient='h')
    for x in np.arange(XMIN, XMAX, 2.5):

        axs[i].axvline(x, color='gray', alpha=0.1, zorder=-1)
    axs[i].set_yticks(range(len(concentrations_per_ml)))
    axs[i].set_yticklabels(y_axis_labels)
    axs[i].set_title(f"qPCR target: {qpcr_target.strip()}, Extraction kit: {extraction_kit.strip()}, PCR instrument: {pcr_instrument.strip()}")
    axs[i].set_xlim(XMIN, XMAX)
    axs[i].spines['top'].set_color('none')
    axs[i].spines['right'].set_color('none')
plt.show()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/cell-4-output-1.png){width=758 height=431}
:::
:::


# Differing NA Extraction kits

## Plotting qPCR results for different NA extraction kits

::: {#f68402fc .cell execution_count=4}
``` {.python .cell-code}
data = pd.read_csv("data/s2-na-kits-claude.tsv", sep="\t")
data = data.apply(lambda x: x.str.strip() if x.dtype == "string" else x)
data.columns = [col.strip() for col in data.columns]

Y_MIN, Y_MAX = (28,40)

# Extract unique combinations of qPCR target, Extraction kit, and PCR instrument
unique_combinations = data[['qPCR target', 'RT-PCR kit', 'PCR instrument']].drop_duplicates().values.tolist()
concentrations_per_ml = ["2_e3", "1_e3", "5_e2", "2_e2"]

table_iterator = -1
for qpcr_target, qpcr_kit, pcr_instrument in unique_combinations:
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(9, 5))
    table_iterator += 1


    sub_table = data[(data['qPCR target'] == qpcr_target) & (data['RT-PCR kit'] == qpcr_kit) & (data['PCR instrument'] == pcr_instrument)]
    extraction_kits = sub_table['extraction kit'].unique().tolist()
    n_extraction_kits = len(extraction_kits)
    x_increment = 0.7 / n_extraction_kits

    x_offset = -0.45


    for extraction_kit in extraction_kits:
        x_offset += x_increment
        y_means = sub_table[sub_table['extraction kit'] == extraction_kit][["mean_2_e3", "mean_1_e3", "mean_5_e2", "mean_2_e2"]].values.flatten()
        n_labs_values = sub_table[sub_table['extraction kit'] == extraction_kit][["n_labs_2_e3", "n_labs_1_e3", "n_labs_5_e2", "n_labs_2_e2"]].values.flatten()
        min_n_labs = min(n_labs_values)
        max_n_labs = max(n_labs_values)
        if min_n_labs == max_n_labs:
            n_labs_label = f"n = {min_n_labs}"
        else:
            n_labs_label = f"n = {min_n_labs} - {max_n_labs}"

        y_sds = sub_table[sub_table['extraction kit'] == extraction_kit][["sd_2_e3", "sd_1_e3", "sd_5_e2", "sd_2_e2"]].values.flatten()
        x_values = [x + x_offset for x in range(len(y_means))]
        ax.errorbar(x_values, y_means, y_sds, alpha=0.5, label=f"{extraction_kit}\n({n_labs_label})", fmt='o')
        ax.legend(loc='upper center', bbox_to_anchor=(0.5, -0.05), frameon=False, ncol=4, title="Extraction kit")


    ax.set_xticks(range(len(y_means)))
    ax.set_ylim(Y_MIN, Y_MAX)
    for x in range(Y_MIN, Y_MAX, 2):
        ax.axhline(x, color='gray', alpha=0.1)
    x_labels = []
    for concentration in concentrations_per_ml:
        tidy_concentration  = concentration.replace("_", " ").replace("e", "E")
        label = f"{tidy_concentration} gc / ml"
        x_labels.append(label)
    ax.set_xticklabels(x_labels)
    qpcr_target, qpcr_kit, pcr_instrument = qpcr_target.strip(), qpcr_kit.strip(), pcr_instrument.strip()
    plt.title(f"qPCR target: {qpcr_target}, qPCR kit: {qpcr_kit}, PCR instrument: {pcr_instrument}")
    ax.spines['top'].set_color('none')
    ax.spines['right'].set_color('none')

```

## Plotting aggregate distribution of samples where only the NA extraction kit differed

::: {#8b9ec4a9 .cell execution_count=5}
``` {.python .cell-code}
data = pd.read_csv("data/s2-na-kits-claude.tsv", sep="\t")
data.columns = [col.strip() for col in data.columns]

absolute_sample_size = 3000
XMIN, XMAX = (-10, 10)

# only keep rows where neither extraction kit orPqCR instrumet are == "various"
data = data[~data['extraction kit'].str.contains("various")]
data = data[~data['PCR instrument'].str.contains("various")].reset_index()

unique_combinations = data[['qPCR target', 'RT-PCR kit', 'PCR instrument']].drop_duplicates().values.tolist()

n_unique_combinations = len(unique_combinations)

fig, axs = plt.subplots(n_unique_combinations, figsize=(9, 2.5 * n_unique_combinations), sharex=True)

concentrations_per_ml = ["2_e3", "1_e3", "5_e2", "2_e2"]

for i, (qpcr_target, qpcr_kit, pcr_instrument) in enumerate(unique_combinations):
    sub_table = data[(data['qPCR target'] == qpcr_target) & (data['RT-PCR kit'] == qpcr_kit) & (data['PCR instrument'] == pcr_instrument)]

    distributions = []
    y_axis_labels = []


    for concentration in concentrations_per_ml:
        means = sub_table[f"mean_{concentration}"].values.tolist()
        sds = sub_table[f"sd_{concentration}"].values.tolist()
        n_labs = sub_table[f"n_labs_{concentration}"].values.tolist()
        total_labs = sum(n_labs)
        sample_per_lab = absolute_sample_size // total_labs

        samples = np.hstack([np.random.normal(m, sd, sample_per_lab * n) for m, sd, n in zip(means, sds, n_labs)])
        mean = np.mean(samples)
        distribution_around_zero = samples - mean
        distributions.append(distribution_around_zero)
        y_axis_labels.append(concentration + "\n" + f"n = {total_labs}")



    sns.violinplot(data=distributions, ax=axs[i], orient='h')
    axs[i].set_yticks(range(len(concentrations_per_ml)))
    axs[i].set_yticklabels(y_axis_labels)
    axs[i].set_title(f"qPCR target: {qpcr_target.strip()}, qPCR kit: {qpcr_kit.strip()}, PCR instrument: {pcr_instrument.strip()}")
    axs[i].set_xlim(XMIN, XMAX)
    axs[i].spines['top'].set_color('none')
    axs[i].spines['right'].set_color('none')
plt.show()
```

# Differing PCR machines

## Plotting qPCR results for different qPCR machines

::: {#ffdd3dcc .cell execution_count=6}
``` {.python .cell-code}
data = pd.read_csv("data/s3-qpcr-machines-claude.tsv", sep="\t")
data = data.apply(lambda x: x.str.strip() if x.dtype == "string" else x)
data.columns = [col.strip() for col in data.columns]

Y_MIN, Y_MAX = (28,40)

unique_combinations = data[['qPCR target', 'extraction kit', 'RT-PCR kit']].drop_duplicates().values.tolist()
concentrations_per_ml = ["2_e3", "1_e3", "5_e2", "2_e2"]

table_iterator = -1
for qpcr_target, extraction_kit, qpcr_kit in unique_combinations:
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(9, 5))
    table_iterator += 1

    sub_table = data[(data['qPCR target'] == qpcr_target) & (data['extraction kit'] == extraction_kit) & (data['RT-PCR kit'] == qpcr_kit)]
    pcr_instruments = sub_table['PCR instrument'].unique().tolist()
    n_pcr_instruments = len(pcr_instruments)
    x_increment = 0.7 / n_pcr_instruments

    x_offset = -0.45
    for pcr_instrument in pcr_instruments:
        x_offset += x_increment

        y_means = sub_table[sub_table['PCR instrument'] == pcr_instrument][["mean_2_e3", "mean_1_e3", "mean_5_e2", "mean_2_e2"]].values.flatten()
        n_labs_values = sub_table[sub_table['PCR instrument'] == pcr_instrument][["n_labs_2_e3", "n_labs_1_e3", "n_labs_5_e2", "n_labs_2_e2"]].values.flatten()
        min_n_labs = min(n_labs_values)
        max_n_labs = max(n_labs_values)
        if min_n_labs == max_n_labs:
            n_labs_label = f"n = {min_n_labs}"
        else:
            n_labs_label = f"n = {min_n_labs} - {max_n_labs}"

        y_sds = sub_table[sub_table['PCR instrument'] == pcr_instrument][["sd_2_e3", "sd_1_e3", "sd_5_e2", "sd_2_e2"]].values.flatten()
        x_values = [x + x_offset for x in range(len(y_means))]
        ax.errorbar(x_values, y_means, y_sds, alpha=0.5, label=f"{pcr_instrument}\n({n_labs_label})", fmt='o')
        ax.legend(loc='upper center', bbox_to_anchor=(0.5, -0.05), frameon=False, ncol=4, title="PCR instrument")

    ax.set_ylim(Y_MIN, Y_MAX)
    ax.set_xticks(range(len(y_means)))
    for x in range(Y_MIN, Y_MAX, 2):
        ax.axhline(x, color='gray', alpha=0.1)
    x_labels = []
    for concentration in concentrations_per_ml:
        tidy_concentration  = concentration.replace("_", " ").replace("e", "E")
        label = f"{tidy_concentration} gc / ml"
        x_labels.append(label)
    ax.set_xticklabels(x_labels)
    qpcr_target, extraction_kit, qpcr_kit = qpcr_target.strip(), extraction_kit.strip(), qpcr_kit.strip()
    plt.title(f"qPCR target: {qpcr_target}, Extraction kit: {extraction_kit}, qPCR kit: {qpcr_kit}")
    ax.spines['top'].set_color('none')
    ax.spines['right'].set_color('none')
```

## Plotting aggregate distribution of samples where only the RT-PCR kit differed

::: {#d86d4fff .cell execution_count=7}
``` {.python .cell-code}
data = pd.read_csv("data/s3-qpcr-machines-claude.tsv", sep="\t")
data.columns = [col.strip() for col in data.columns]

absolute_sample_size = 3000
XMIN, XMAX = (-10, 10)

# only keep rows where neither extraction kit orPqCR instrumet are == "various"
data = data[~data['extraction kit'].str.contains("various")]
data = data[~data['PCR instrument'].str.contains("various")].reset_index()

unique_combinations = data[['qPCR target', 'RT-PCR kit', 'extraction kit']].drop_duplicates().values.tolist()

n_unique_combinations = len(unique_combinations)

fig, axs = plt.subplots(n_unique_combinations, figsize=(9, 2.5 * n_unique_combinations), sharex=True)

concentrations_per_ml = ["2_e3", "1_e3", "5_e2", "2_e2"]

for i, (qpcr_target, qpcr_kit, extraction_kit) in enumerate(unique_combinations):
    sub_table = data[(data['qPCR target'] == qpcr_target) & (data['RT-PCR kit'] == qpcr_kit) & (data['extraction kit'] == extraction_kit)]

    distributions = []
    y_axis_labels = []


    for concentration in concentrations_per_ml:
        means = sub_table[f"mean_{concentration}"].values.tolist()
        sds = sub_table[f"sd_{concentration}"].values.tolist()
        n_labs = sub_table[f"n_labs_{concentration}"].values.tolist()
        total_labs = sum(n_labs)
        sample_per_lab = absolute_sample_size // total_labs

        samples = np.hstack([np.random.normal(m, sd, sample_per_lab * n) for m, sd, n in zip(means, sds, n_labs)])
        mean = np.mean(samples)
        distribution_around_zero = samples - mean
        distributions.append(distribution_around_zero)
        y_axis_labels.append(concentration + "\n" + f"n = {total_labs}")



    sns.violinplot(data=distributions, ax=axs[i], orient='h')
    axs[i].set_yticks(range(len(concentrations_per_ml)))
    axs[i].set_yticklabels(y_axis_labels)
    axs[i].set_title(f"qPCR target: {qpcr_target.strip()}, qPCR kit: {qpcr_kit.strip()}, Extraction kit: {extraction_kit.strip()}")
    axs[i].set_xlim(XMIN, XMAX)
    axs[i].spines['top'].set_color('none')
    axs[i].spines['right'].set_color('none')
plt.show()
```

## Plotting qPCR results for different labs who all use the same protocol

::: {#9d8bcfed .cell execution_count=8}
``` {.python .cell-code}
# Load the new dataset
data = pd.read_csv("data/s4-individual-labs-claude.tsv", sep="\t")
data = data.apply(lambda x: x.str.strip() if x.dtype == "string" else x)
data.columns = [col.strip() for col in data.columns]

Y_MIN, Y_MAX = (28,40)


unique_combinations = data[['qPCR target', 'extraction kit', 'RT-PCR kit', 'PCR instrument']].drop_duplicates().values.tolist()
concentrations_per_ml = ["2_e3", "1_e3", "5_e2", "2_e2"]

table_iterator = -1
for qpcr_target, extraction_kit, qpcr_kit, pcr_instrument in unique_combinations:
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(9, 5))
    table_iterator += 1

    sub_table = data[(data['qPCR target'] == qpcr_target) & (data['extraction kit'] == extraction_kit) & (data['RT-PCR kit'] == qpcr_kit) & (data['PCR instrument'] == pcr_instrument)]
    lab_codes = sub_table['lab_code'].unique().tolist()  # Use lab_code
    n_lab_codes = len(lab_codes)  # Use n_lab_codes
    x_increment = 0.7 / n_lab_codes

    x_offset = -0.45
    for lab_code in lab_codes:  # Iterate over lab_code

        y_means = sub_table[sub_table['lab_code'] == lab_code][["mean_2_e3", "mean_1_e3", "mean_5_e2", "mean_2_e2"]].values.flatten()
        n_samples_values = sub_table[sub_table['lab_code'] == lab_code][["n_samples_2_e3", "n_samples_1_e3", "n_samples_5_e2", "n_samples_2_e2"]].values.flatten()


        y_sds = sub_table[sub_table['lab_code'] == lab_code][["sd_2_e3", "sd_1_e3", "sd_5_e2", "sd_2_e2"]].values.flatten()
        x_offset += x_increment
        x_values = [x + x_offset for x in range(len(y_means))]
        ax.errorbar(x_values, y_means, y_sds, alpha=0.5, label=f"{lab_code}", fmt='o')
        ax.legend(loc='upper center', bbox_to_anchor=(0.5, -0.05), frameon=False, ncol=4, title="Lab Code")

    ax.set_ylim(Y_MIN, Y_MAX)
    ax.set_xticks(range(len(y_means)))
    for x in range(Y_MIN, Y_MAX, 2):
        ax.axhline(x, color='gray', alpha=0.1)
    x_labels = []
    for concentration in concentrations_per_ml:
        tidy_concentration  = concentration.replace("_", " ").replace("e", "E")
        label = f"{tidy_concentration} gc / ml"
        x_labels.append(label)
    ax.set_xticklabels(x_labels)
    qpcr_target, extraction_kit, qpcr_kit = qpcr_target.strip(), extraction_kit.strip(), qpcr_kit.strip()
    plt.title(f"qPCR target: {qpcr_target}, Extraction kit: {extraction_kit}, qPCR kit: {qpcr_kit}, PCR instrument: {pcr_instrument}")
    ax.spines['top'].set_color('none')
    ax.spines['right'].set_color('none')

```

## Plotting aggregate distribution of samples where labs differed

::: {#a8d81b94 .cell execution_count=9}
``` {.python .cell-code}
data = pd.read_csv("data/s4-individual-labs-claude.tsv", sep="\t")
data.columns = [col.strip() for col in data.columns]

samples_per_lab = 300
XMIN, XMAX = (-10, 10)



unique_combinations = data[['qPCR target', 'RT-PCR kit', 'extraction kit', 'PCR instrument']].drop_duplicates().values.tolist()

n_unique_combinations = len(unique_combinations)
fig, axs = plt.subplots(n_unique_combinations, figsize=(9, 2.5 * n_unique_combinations), sharex=True)

concentrations_per_ml = ["2_e3", "1_e3", "5_e2", "2_e2"]

for i, (qpcr_target, qpcr_kit, extraction_kit, pcr_instrument) in enumerate(unique_combinations):
    sub_table = data[(data['qPCR target'] == qpcr_target) & (data['RT-PCR kit'] == qpcr_kit) & (data['extraction kit'] == extraction_kit) & (data['PCR instrument'] == pcr_instrument)]
    distributions = []
    y_axis_labels = []


    for concentration in concentrations_per_ml:
        means = sub_table[f"mean_{concentration}"].values.tolist()
        sds = sub_table[f"sd_{concentration}"].values.tolist()
        n_labs = len(means)


        samples = np.hstack([np.random.normal(m, sd, samples_per_lab) for m, sd in zip(means, sds)])
        mean = np.mean(samples)
        distribution_around_zero = samples - mean
        distributions.append(distribution_around_zero)
        y_axis_labels.append(concentration + "\n" + f"n = {n_labs}")



    sns.violinplot(data=distributions, ax=axs[i], orient='h')
    axs[i].set_yticks(range(len(concentrations_per_ml)))
    axs[i].set_yticklabels(y_axis_labels)
    axs[i].set_title(f"qPCR target: {qpcr_target.strip()}, qPCR kit: {qpcr_kit.strip()}, Extraction kit: {extraction_kit.strip()}, PCR instrument: {pcr_instrument.strip()}")
    axs[i].set_xlim(XMIN, XMAX)
    axs[i].spines['top'].set_color('none')
    axs[i].spines['right'].set_color('none')
plt.show()
```
